title: 7 things every female founder needs to know about funding - regardless of how big or small their business
text:
The gender gap in funding for women-led businesses has become a hot topic of conversation, thanks to a raft of research and welcome initiatives that have been shining a light on the exponential value female-driven business can add to the economy - if founders have access to equal opportunities and the right support.

The Rose Review, spearheaded by Natwest’s Alison Rose and prompted by the Telegraph's Women Mean Business campaign, found that as much as £250 billion in new value could be added to the UK economy with a sustained and concerted effort to help women succeed as entrepreneurs. In July, the government launched the Investing in Women Code, encouraging transparency from banks as to how...
